answers.answer: The Iași County Immigration Service can be contacted via email at is.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0232 302 315 and 0232 302 322.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: For urgent medical services, individuals can contact the County Emergency Clinical Hospital "Sf. Spiridon" Iași, or the Emergency Clinical Hospital for Children "Sf. Maria" Iași for child-related emergencies.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: The provided information states that details are required for the accommodation, board, and integration support program, but it does not specify what information is needed.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Iași'.

answers.answer: Details about public transport ticket costs, payment methods, and public transport areas in Iași can be found via a link mentioned on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: Organizations in Iași offer various psychological support services, including general psychological assistance, psychosocial support events, mental health awareness, first aid, training, workshops, supervision, and mental health consultations.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) provides psychological support by referencing vulnerable individuals to resources, organizing psychosocial and mental health awareness events, and offering training. Project HOPE provides a variety of psychological assistance with consultations available in multiple languages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The multi-service center for children and adolescents organizes a kindergarten with an extended program, school preparation for students, a Ukrainian language school for grades 1-11, and an integration program into the Romanian education system through creative lessons and sport activities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Free Romanian language courses in Iași are offered by Inspectoratul Școlar Județean Iași, Centrul de Asistență Umanitară și Socială pentru Refugiați CTR Nicolina, Crucea Roșie, and Caritas.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: After completing the Romanian language program and passing an evaluation offered by Inspectoratul Școlar Județean Iași, one can obtain a language certificate attesting their knowledge and skills.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: The CTR Nicolina Refugee Center provides accommodation, products, food, medical assistance, psychological counseling, Romanian language courses, and organizes a kindergarten and educational activities for children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Romanian National Council for Refugees (CNRR) offers legal advice and information on topics such as the asylum procedure, child protection, and integration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The ICAR Foundation offers support for accessing medical services and medicines, in addition to socio-cultural activities, information, integration, and psychological support.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Women's Center in Iași offers support for accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and services dedicated to victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: Individuals arriving in Romania who need HIV psycho-medical-social services can access them by visiting consilierehiv.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.

answers.answer: Justiție pentru minori provides accommodation and meals for mothers and children, along with mediation services, legal advice for family reunification, and support for accessing medical and other needed services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: AIDRom offers support for accessing medical services, legal assistance, and reimbursements for legalized translation services, in addition to psychological counseling and socio-cultural activities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania can be contacted at 0800 800 678 or 021 313 3100.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: Refugees can access free family medicine services in Iași through a list provided on the website, which is not directly included in this text.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Medical services'.
